meanings.sent1: The disintegrative force of the storm shattered the windows.
meanings.sent2: The old building showed signs of disintegrative decay.
meanings.sent3: The disintegrative effect of the prank left everyone in stitches.
meanings.sent4: The disintegrative relationship between the two countries led to conflict.
meanings.sent5: The disintegrative power of the earthquake was felt for miles around.

meanings.definition: Tending to disintegrate or break apart.
meanings.sent1: The disintegrative nature of the fabric made it tear easily.
meanings.sent2: The disintegrative tendencies of the material were evident in the fraying edges.
meanings.sent3: The disintegrative quality of the joke caused laughter to erupt.
meanings.sent4: The disintegrative atmosphere in the room made it hard to focus.
meanings.sent5: The disintegrative properties of the glue failed to hold the pieces together.
